uses.description: Casts an action from the task's assigned actor at their current position. This form is actor-initiated, meaning the actor performs the action as if they chose to use it themselves.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the action to cast. This should match an action defined in the game data.

uses.description: Makes a specific actor use an action, optionally targeting a tile coordinate. The specified actor initiates the action as if they chose to perform it. This allows precise control over which actor performs the action and where they target it.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the action to execute. This should match an action defined in the game data.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The ID of the actor who will perform the action. This actor must exist in the current zone for this behavior to trigger.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The target tile coordinate where the action should be directed. If not provided, defaults to tile (-1, -1).

uses.description: Directly executes an action at a location without being initiated by a specific actor. The action simply happens at the target location rather than being performed by an actor. If a tile coordinate is provided, the action executes there; otherwise, it executes at the task's assigned actor's current position. To use this mode, the second string must be either empty or reference an actor ID that doesn't exist in the current zone.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the action to execute. This should match an action defined in the game data.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: An actor ID value that must be either an empty string or an invalid/non-existent actor ID to trigger direct execution mode. If this references a valid actor, the task will use actor-initiated behavior instead.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The target tile coordinate where the action should execute. If not provided or set to (-1, -1), the action executes at the task's assigned actor's current position instead.

uses.description: Executes an action at the position of a specific party member, identified by their index in the party roster. The action targets and executes at that party member's current tile location. If the specified party index doesn't exist (index is out of range), this task does nothing.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the action to execute. This action will be executed at the specified party member's position.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The zero-based index of the party member in the party roster. For example, 0 refers to the first party member, 1 to the second, and so on.

uses.description: Applies an elemental reaction to a specific tile. This causes the tile's terrain or features to react with the specified element, potentially changing the tile's state, creating effects, or triggering element-based interactions.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The element type to apply to the tile. This should be a valid Element enum value (such as fire, ice, lightning, etc.).

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate where the element should be applied. If not provided, defaults to tile (-1, -1).

uses.description: Applies an elemental reaction to a rectangular area of tiles. The element is applied to each tile in the specified area, starting from a top-left corner and covering a width and height. Optionally, a delay increment can be specified to stagger the application timing across tiles, creating a spreading or cascading effect.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The element type to apply to the tiles. This should be a valid Element enum value (such as fire, ice, lightning, etc.).

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The size of the rectangular area as a TileCoord, where X represents the width and Y represents the height of the area. For example, '3,2' creates a 3-wide by 2-tall rectangle.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The top-left corner tile coordinate of the rectangular area where elements will be applied. If not provided, defaults to tile (-1, -1).

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The delay increment added for each successive tile in the area. This creates a staggered timing effect, with each tile's reaction delayed slightly more than the previous one, producing a spreading visual effect.

uses.description: Applies an elemental reaction to the entire current zone, affecting all tiles simultaneously. This is a fast, zone-wide application of an element that can create large-scale environmental effects or state changes across the entire map.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The element type to apply to the zone. This should be a valid Element enum value (such as fire, ice, lightning, etc.).

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: A boolean flag parameter passed to the zone reaction function. Its exact behavior depends on the element and zone reaction implementation.

uses.description: Changes the terrain type of a specific tile to a new terrain. This modifies the tile's fundamental terrain properties, affecting movement, visuals, and interactions. The change respects terrain change rules unless forced.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the new terrain type to apply to the tile. This should match a valid terrain type defined in the game data.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: A boolean flag parameter that affects how the terrain change is applied. The exact behavior depends on the terrain change implementation.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate of the tile whose terrain type should be changed.

uses.description: Executes a Lua script. This allows running custom Lua code to perform complex logic, manipulate game state, or trigger advanced behaviors that aren't available through standard tasks. The script has access to the game's Lua API and environment.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The Lua script code to execute. This should be valid Lua syntax and can use any functions or variables available in the game's Lua environment.

uses.description: Executes a console command as if it were typed into the game's debug console. This provides access to developer commands and debugging features. After execution, debug draw strings are cleared from the display.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The console command to execute. This should be a valid command recognized by the game's console command handler.

uses.description: Toggles the pause state of actors and actions in the current zone. If the game is currently paused, this unpauses it; if unpaused, this pauses it. When paused, actors and actions in the zone are frozen and do not update or execute.

Prevents player interaction for a specified duration. During this time, the player cannot interact with objects, NPCs, or trigger interactive elements. This is useful for cutscenes or scripted sequences where player input should be temporarily disabled.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The duration in seconds to prevent interaction. The interaction block will last for this amount of time before automatically expiring.

uses.description: Delays the execution of the next action in the zone by a specified duration. If there is already a delay set, this task will use whichever delay is longer (the existing delay or the new delay). This creates a pause between actions, useful for pacing scripted sequences or combat events.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The delay duration in seconds. The next action will be delayed by at least this amount of time, or longer if a longer delay is already set.

uses.description: Controls cutscene mode for the current zone. When cutscene mode is enabled, special gameplay restrictions apply and the speed-up enemy turn toggle is disabled. If no boolean is provided, cutscene mode is enabled by default. When cutscene mode is disabled, normal gameplay resumes.

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: Whether to enable or disable cutscene mode. True enables cutscene mode, false disables it. If not provided, defaults to true (enabling cutscene mode).

uses.description: Sets the game's time speed multiplier. This controls how fast time passes in the game world, affecting day/night cycles, timed events, and other time-dependent systems. A value of 1.0 is normal speed, values greater than 1.0 speed up time, and values less than 1.0 slow it down.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The time speed multiplier. For example, 2.0 makes time pass twice as fast, 0.5 makes it pass at half speed, and 1.0 is normal speed.

uses.description: Sets whether a faction is hostile or friendly. This changes the faction's relationship with the player and other factions, affecting combat behavior and interactions. When set to hostile, the faction's members will attack the player; when set to friendly, they will not. An optional tile coordinate parameter affects how the hostility is applied.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the faction whose hostility status should be changed. This should match a faction defined in the game data.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The hostility value. Values of 1.0 or greater set the faction to hostile, while values less than 1.0 set the faction to friendly.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: An optional tile coordinate parameter. When provided (not (-1, -1)), the X coordinate value affects how the hostility change is applied. The exact behavior depends on the setFactionHostile implementation.

uses.description: Changes the AI behavior of a faction. This controls how members of the faction make decisions, choose targets, and act during their turns. Different AI types can make factions more aggressive, defensive, passive, or follow custom behavior patterns.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the faction whose AI should be changed. This should match a faction defined in the game data.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The ID of the AI type to assign to the faction. This should match a valid AI type defined in the game data.

uses.description: Incapacitates all actors belonging to a specified faction in the current zone. Each actor in the faction becomes incapacitated, causing them to fall and become unable to act. This is a zone-wide effect that affects all members of the faction simultaneously.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the faction whose members should be incapacitated. All actors in the current zone with this faction will become incapacitated.

uses.description: Completely removes all actors belonging to a specified faction from the current zone. Unlike killFaction which incapacitates actors, this task removes them entirely from the game world. If a special zone exists, actors from that faction are also removed from the special zone. This is a permanent removal that deletes the actors rather than just disabling them.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the faction whose members should be removed. All actors in the current zone (and special zone if present) with this faction will be completely removed from the game.

uses.description: Changes all actors from one faction to another faction. This reassigns the faction membership of actors, affecting their allegiances, hostilities, and behaviors. All actors currently belonging to the first faction will be moved to the second faction.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the source faction. All actors currently in this faction will be changed to the target faction.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The ID of the target faction. All actors from the source faction will be reassigned to this faction.

uses.description: Transitions the game to a new zone, loading the specified zone and positioning the player at a target location. This handles the zone change, including loading the new zone data and setting up the player's starting position. A brief interaction delay is automatically applied to prevent immediate input after the zone transition.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the zone to move to. This should match a zone defined in the game data.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: A numeric parameter passed to the zone transition function. The exact purpose depends on the moveToNewZone implementation.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate where the player should be positioned in the new zone. If not provided, defaults to tile (-1, -1).

uses.description: Initiates travel to another zone when used in combat mode. This prompts the player with a dialog asking if they want to flee to the destination zone. The tile coordinates are passed as parameters to the flee dialog. If not in combat mode or if in action mode, this use case may not apply.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the destination zone to flee to. This should match a zone defined in the game data.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: An integer value (cast from float) passed to the flee dialog. This may control flee cost or other flee-related parameters.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate used in the flee prompt parameters, passed as 'X,Y' coordinates. If not provided, defaults to tile (-1, -1), which would be passed as '-1,-1'.

uses.description: Initiates direct travel to another zone when used outside of combat mode (but not during action mode). The player is moved to the specified zone at the target tile coordinate, with control over whether autosave occurs during the transition. If in combat mode or action mode, this use case may not apply.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the destination zone to travel to. This should match a zone defined in the game data.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: A parameter passed to the zone travel function. This may control travel-related behavior or timing.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Controls autosave behavior during travel. When true, autosave is disabled for this travel; when false, autosave is enabled.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate where the player should arrive in the destination zone. If not provided, defaults to tile (-1, -1).

uses.description: Initiates travel to a zone using a point-based coordinate system when in combat mode. This prompts the player with a flee dialog, using a special coordinate format (-99, point_value) to identify the destination. This is typically used for abstract travel points rather than specific tile coordinates.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the destination zone to flee to. This should match a zone defined in the game data.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The point value used to identify the destination location within the zone, passed to the flee dialog with the special -99 X coordinate format.

uses.description: Initiates direct travel to a zone using a point-based coordinate system when outside of combat mode. The player is moved to the specified zone using a special coordinate format (-99, point_value) that identifies a travel point rather than a tile coordinate. This allows control over autosave behavior and whether the zone is entered via console mode.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the destination zone to travel to. This should match a zone defined in the game data.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The point value that identifies the destination location within the zone. This is used as the Y coordinate in a special TileCoord(-99, point_value) format.

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: Controls autosave behavior during travel. When true, autosave is disabled for this travel; when false, autosave is enabled. If not provided, defaults to true (autosave enabled).

optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: When true, sets a flag indicating the zone is being entered via console mode. This may affect zone initialization or behavior. If not provided or false, normal zone entry occurs.

uses.description: Initiates travel to a zone using a point-based coordinate system when in combat mode, with the zone ID retrieved from a global variable. This prompts the player with a flee dialog. The zone name is looked up from the global variable specified in the first string parameter.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable that contains the destination zone ID. The value of this global variable should be a valid zone ID.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The point value used to identify the destination location within the zone, passed to the flee dialog with the special -99 X coordinate format.

uses.description: Initiates direct travel to a zone using a point-based coordinate system when outside of combat mode, with the zone ID retrieved from a global variable. The zone name is looked up from the global variable specified in the first string parameter. This allows control over autosave behavior and whether the zone is entered via console mode.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable that contains the destination zone ID. The value of this global variable should be a valid zone ID.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The point value that identifies the destination location within the zone. This is used as the Y coordinate in a special TileCoord(-99, point_value) format.

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: Controls autosave behavior during travel. When true, autosave is disabled for this travel; when false, autosave is enabled. If not provided, defaults to true (autosave enabled).

optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: When true, sets a flag indicating the zone is being entered via console mode. This may affect zone initialization or behavior. If not provided or false, normal zone entry occurs.

uses.description: Leaves the current location when in combat mode, prompting the player with a flee confirmation dialog. If a specific tile coordinate is provided and the first boolean is false, that coordinate is used for the leave destination; otherwise, the origin coordinate (0,0) is used. The dialog is triggered with a specific confirmation callback for leaving locations during combat.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Controls whether to use a custom tile coordinate or default to origin. When false and no tile coordinate is provided, the destination defaults to tile (0,0). When true, the provided tile coordinate is used.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The destination tile coordinate for leaving the location. If not provided, defaults to tile (-1,-1), which may then be changed to (0,0) based on bools[0].

uses.description: Leaves the current location when outside of combat mode, immediately transitioning away from the current location. The departure uses the specified tile coordinate (or a default based on the first boolean) and controls autosave behavior. This is a direct leave action without a confirmation dialog.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Controls whether to use a custom tile coordinate or default to origin. When false and no tile coordinate is provided, the destination defaults to tile (0,0). When true, the provided tile coordinate is used.

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: Controls autosave behavior when leaving. When true, autosave is disabled; when false, autosave is enabled.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The destination tile coordinate for leaving the location. If not provided, defaults to tile (-1,-1), which may then be changed to (0,0) based on bools[0].

uses.description: Travels to the player's previous zone using coordinates and zone name stored in global variables, when in combat mode. This prompts a flee dialog to return to the last known player position. The zone name is read from the 'playerPrevZone' global variable, and the coordinates are read from 'playerX' and 'playerY' global variables.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: An integer value (cast from float) passed to the flee dialog, likely controlling flee cost or other flee parameters.

uses.description: Travels to the player's previous zone using coordinates and zone name stored in global variables, when outside of combat mode. The player is moved to the position stored in 'playerX' and 'playerY' global variables within the zone specified by 'playerPrevZone' global variable. This provides a way to return to a saved player position.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: A parameter passed to the zone travel function, likely controlling travel-related timing or behavior.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Controls autosave behavior during travel. When true, autosave is disabled; when false, autosave is enabled.

uses.description: Initiates travel to another zone when in combat mode, prompting a flee dialog. This is similar to the standard travel task but specifically designed for scenarios where autosave should not occur.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the destination zone to flee to. This should match a zone defined in the game data.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: An integer value (cast from float) passed to the flee dialog, likely controlling flee cost or other flee parameters.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The target tile coordinate, used in the flee prompt parameters. If not provided, defaults to tile (-1, -1).

uses.description: Directly travels to another zone when outside of combat mode, explicitly disabling autosave during the transition. This performs both a zone travel and a zone move operation, ensuring the player is relocated without triggering an autosave. A brief interaction delay is applied after the transition.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the destination zone to travel to. This should match a zone defined in the game data.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: A timing parameter passed to both the travel and move functions, controlling transition speed or delay.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate where the player should arrive in the destination zone. If not provided, defaults to tile (-1, -1).

uses.description: Creates and travels to a procedurally generated world. The procedural world is generated with a starting zone template and an end destination zone, creating a series of connected zones between them. The return coordinates determine where the player returns to if they leave the procedural world. These coordinates can be explicitly provided via tile coordinates or automatically calculated based on task area bounds.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the zone template to use as the basis for the procedural world generation. This defines the style and content of the generated zones.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: Comma-separated values specifying the end destination zone and optionally a bottom exit override. Format: 'endZoneID' or 'endZoneID,bottomExitOverride'. Spaces are automatically stripped from this value before parsing.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Controls autosave behavior when entering the procedural world. When true, autosave is disabled; when false, autosave is enabled.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The return coordinates (X,Y) where the player will return to if they leave the procedural world. If not provided, defaults to (-1, -1). If bools[1] is true, these coordinates are overridden with calculated values based on the task area.

optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: When true, automatically calculates the return coordinates based on the task's area bounds (centered horizontally at the bottom edge plus one tile). When false, uses the provided tile coordinates. If not provided, defaults to false.

uses.description: Creates and travels to a procedurally generated world with a point-based entry system. Similar to travel_procedural, but allows specifying an integer point value that controls some aspect of the procedural generation or entry. The procedural world is generated with a starting zone template and an end destination zone.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the zone template to use as the basis for the procedural world generation. This defines the style and content of the generated zones.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: Comma-separated values specifying the end destination zone and optionally a bottom exit override. Format: 'endZoneID' or 'endZoneID,bottomExitOverride'. Spaces are automatically stripped from this value before parsing.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Controls autosave behavior when entering the procedural world. When true, autosave is disabled; when false, autosave is enabled.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: An integer point value (cast from float) passed to the procedural world creation. This may control the entry point, difficulty level, or other generation parameters specific to point-based procedural worlds.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The return coordinates (X,Y) where the player will return to if they leave the procedural world. If not provided, defaults to (-1, -1). If bools[1] is true, these coordinates are overridden with calculated values based on the task area.

optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: When true, automatically calculates the return coordinates based on the task's area bounds (centered horizontally at the bottom edge plus one tile). When false, uses the provided tile coordinates. If not provided, defaults to false.

uses.description: Initiates travel to another zone when in combat mode, prompting a flee dialog. This is similar to standard travel but associated with setting a return path for later navigation.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the destination zone to flee to. This should match a zone defined in the game data.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: An integer value (cast from float) passed to the flee dialog, likely controlling flee cost or other flee parameters.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The target tile coordinate, used in the flee prompt parameters. If not provided, defaults to tile (-1, -1).

uses.description: Travels to another zone while setting a return path that can be used to navigate back to the current location. An autosave is performed before the travel. The return path coordinates can be explicitly provided or automatically calculated based on the task area. This allows creating a two-way travel connection where the player can later return to this exact spot.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the destination zone to travel to. This should match a zone defined in the game data.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: A timing parameter controlling the zone transition speed or delay.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate where the player should arrive in the destination zone. If not provided, defaults to tile (-1, -1). Note: This is separate from the return path coordinates.

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: When true, automatically calculates the return path coordinates based on the task's area bounds (centered horizontally at the bottom edge plus one tile). When false or not provided, the return path coordinates default to (-1, -1).

uses.description: Returns to a previously set zone using a return path when in combat mode. This prompts a flee dialog to navigate back to the specified zone. If the zone string is empty, this task does nothing.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the zone to return to, typically set by a previous travel_setReturnPath task. If this is an empty string, the task does nothing.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: An integer value (cast from float) passed to the flee dialog, likely controlling flee cost or other flee parameters.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The target tile coordinate, used in the flee prompt parameters. If not provided, defaults to tile (-1, -1).

uses.description: Returns to a previously set zone using a return path when outside of combat mode. An autosave is performed before the return travel. The player is moved to the specified zone at the target coordinates. If the zone string is empty, this task does nothing.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the zone to return to, typically set by a previous travel_setReturnPath task. If this is an empty string, the task does nothing.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: A timing parameter controlling the zone transition speed or delay.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate where the player should arrive in the return zone. If not provided, defaults to tile (-1, -1).

uses.description: Travels to the last procedural zone entry point when in combat mode, prompting a flee dialog. The zone ID is retrieved from the 'lastProcZoneEntry' global variable, which typically stores the entry point to a procedurally generated world.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: An integer value (cast from float) passed to the flee dialog, likely controlling flee cost or other flee parameters.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The target tile coordinate, used in the flee prompt parameters. If not provided, defaults to tile (-1, -1).

uses.description: Travels to the last procedural zone entry point when outside of combat mode. The zone ID is retrieved from the 'lastProcZoneEntry' global variable. An autosave is performed before the travel. This provides a way to return to the entry point of a procedurally generated world.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: A timing parameter controlling the zone transition speed or delay.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate where the player should arrive in the destination zone. If not provided, defaults to tile (-1, -1).

uses.description: Sets a global variable to a string value. Global variables persist across zones and game sessions (when saved) and can be used to track quest progress, player choices, or other game state. The variable is identified by name and assigned the specified string value.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable to set. This identifier is used to retrieve the variable's value later.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The string value to assign to the global variable. This must be a non-empty string.

uses.description: Sets a global variable to a numeric value. Global variables persist across zones and game sessions (when saved) and can be used to track counters, scores, or other numeric game state. The variable is identified by name and assigned the specified float value (stored as a string internally).

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable to set. This identifier is used to retrieve the variable's value later.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The numeric value to assign to the global variable. This will be converted to a string for storage.

uses.description: Sets a global variable to the result of a mathematical formula calculation. The formula is evaluated with the task's actor as both the source and target, producing an integer result. The variable is first initialized to '0', then the calculated value is added to it via the modGlobalVar function. This allows for complex calculations involving actor stats, game variables, and mathematical operations.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable to set with the calculated result.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The formula string to evaluate. This should be a valid formula expression that can reference actor values, global variables, and use mathematical operators. The result is cast to an integer.

uses.description: Copies the value from one global variable to another global variable. This reads the string value from the source global variable and assigns it to the destination global variable, effectively creating a duplicate or backup of the value.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the destination global variable that will receive the copied value.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The name of the source global variable whose value will be copied. The value is retrieved as a string.

uses.description: Sets a global variable to the value of a property from the current zone. This reads a property value from the zone object (such as zone ID, name, or other zone attributes) and stores it in a global variable. If the current zone is null, this task does nothing. Achievement checks are bypassed when setting the variable.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable that will receive the zone property value.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The name of the zone property to read. This should match a valid property or field name on the Zone class (such as 'ID', 'zoneName', etc.).

uses.description: Sets a global variable to the actor ID of a specific party member. The party member is identified by their zero-based index in the party roster. If the specified index is out of range (no party member exists at that position), this task does nothing.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable that will receive the party member's actor ID.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The zero-based index of the party member whose actor ID should be retrieved. For example, 0 is the first party member, 1 is the second, and so on.

uses.description: Sets a global variable to the ID of the task's assigned actor. The actor ID is taken from the task's actorID field, which is typically set when the task is created or triggered by an actor. If the task has no assigned actor (empty actor ID), this task does nothing.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable that will receive the task actor's ID.

uses.description: Sets a global variable to a comma-separated concatenation of multiple string values. All strings after the first are joined together with commas between them, creating a single comma-delimited string value. This is useful for setting a global variable value that contains commas, as setGlobalVar would only take the value up until the first comma when used in a task string.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable that will receive the concatenated comma-separated string.

optional.name: strings[1+]
optional.description: The string values to concatenate with commas. All strings from index 1 onward are joined together with comma separators. If no additional strings are provided, the variable is set to an empty string.

uses.description: Clears a global variable, removing it from the game state. This deletes the variable entirely rather than just setting it to an empty or zero value. After clearing, the variable will no longer exist until it is set again.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable to clear and remove from the game state.

uses.description: Modifies a global variable by adding a numeric value to its current value. If the variable doesn't exist or is non-numeric, the behavior depends on the underlying modGlobalVar implementation. This is useful for incrementing counters, scores, or other numeric game state.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable to modify.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The numeric value to add to the global variable. Can be negative to subtract from the variable.

uses.description: Modifies a global variable named after the current dialog node ID by adding 1 to its value. The variable name is taken from the task's currentDialogNodeID field, which is set by the dialog system. This is typically used to track progression through dialog trees or count how many times a dialog node has been visited.

Modifies a global variable named after the current dialog node ID by adding 999 to its value. The variable name is taken from the task's currentDialogNodeID field. This large increment is typically used to mark a dialog node as completed or to trigger specific dialog branching logic based on high values.

Appends a calculated numeric value to an existing global variable's string value. The formula is evaluated and its result is converted to a string, then concatenated to the end of the current variable value. This allows building up strings that contain calculated numbers or combining text with computed values.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable to append to. If the variable doesn't exist, it will be created with an empty string before appending.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The formula string to evaluate. The calculated result will be converted to a string and appended to the variable's current value.

uses.description: Appends a string value to an existing global variable's value. The second string is concatenated to the end of the variable's current value, allowing you to build up longer strings or add text incrementally.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable to append to. If the variable doesn't exist, it will be created with an empty string before appending.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The string value to append to the variable's current value.

uses.description: Appends the current zone's ID to an existing global variable's value. The zone ID is retrieved from the current zone and concatenated to the variable's value. This is useful for tracking which zones have been visited or building zone-specific variable names.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable to append to. The current zone's ID will be concatenated to this variable's current value.

uses.description: Appends the current location's ID to an existing global variable's value. The location ID is retrieved from the current location and concatenated to the variable's value. If there is no current location, this task does nothing. This is useful for tracking location visits or building location-specific data.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable to append to. The current location's ID will be concatenated to this variable's current value.

uses.description: Sets a global variable named after the current dialog node ID to the value 1, but only if it's not already 1. The variable name is taken from the task's currentDialogNodeID field. This is typically used to mark a dialog node as visited or to trigger one-time dialog logic.
Sets a global variable to the numeric value 0. This is useful for resetting counters or initializing numeric variables to a known state.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable to set to 0.

uses.description: Sets a global variable to the ID of the actor the player is currently talking to. The talker ID is retrieved from the input manager's currentActorTalkingTo field. This is useful for tracking which NPC triggered a conversation or for creating actor-specific quest variables.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable that will receive the talking actor's ID.

uses.description: Sets a global variable with a name that combines a base name and the current talker's ID. The variable name is formed by concatenating the base name with the talker's actor ID. The value can be either a string or a numeric value. This allows creating per-NPC variables like 'queststate_npcName' where the NPC name is dynamically included.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The base name for the global variable. The current talker's ID will be appended to this to form the full variable name.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The string value to set. If provided and non-empty, this value is used instead of floats[0].

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The numeric value to set. This is used only if strings[1] is not provided or is empty. Defaults to 0 if neither is provided.

uses.description: Sets a global variable to the ID of the current location. If there is no current location, this task does nothing. This is useful for tracking which location the player is in or for saving location state.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable that will receive the current location's ID.

uses.description: Sets a global variable to a numeric value representing a party actor number or index. Despite the name suggesting it retrieves a party actor number, this task simply sets the variable to the provided float value.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global variable to set.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The numeric value to assign to the global variable.

uses.description: Sets a global variable with a name that combines a base name and the current location's ID. The variable name is formed by concatenating the base name with the location ID, allowing for location-specific variables.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The base name for the global variable. The current location's ID will be appended to this to form the full variable name.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The numeric value to assign to the combined variable name.

uses.description: Sets a global variable (with a name combining a base name and the current location's ID) to the result of a formula calculation. The variable is first initialized to 0, then the calculated value is added to it. This allows for complex calculations involving location-specific variables.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The base name for the global variable. The current location's ID will be appended to this to form the full variable name.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The formula string to evaluate. The result (cast to integer) will be set as the variable's value.

uses.description: Sets a global variable with a name that combines a base name and the current zone's ID. The variable name is formed by concatenating the base name with the zone ID, allowing for zone-specific variables.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The base name for the global variable. The current zone's ID will be appended to this to form the full variable name.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The numeric value to assign to the combined variable name.

uses.description: Modifies the player's fame of a certain type with a visual flourish. The fame value is stored in the "fame_<fameType>" global variable. Default fame types include: "explore", "trade", "combat", "piracy". If you want to add a new type of fame, be sure to include icon images in your mod called "fame_<fameType>.png" and "fame_<fameType>_outlined.png" or else the game will crash.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The type of fame. Usually one of: "explore", "trade", "combat", "piracy"

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The amount to add to (or subtract from, if negative) the current fame value.

uses.description: Navigates to a dialog node with an ID formed by combining the current dialog node ID with a global variable's value. The global variable name is the same as the current dialog node ID. This allows for dynamic dialog branching based on stored state.
Enables the game's UI elements that may have been hidden. This shows the quickslots, character stats, and other UI components, restoring normal UI visibility for gameplay.

Disables and hides the game's UI elements. This hides the quickslots, character stats, and small tab windows, creating a cleaner screen for cutscenes or special gameplay moments. The UI remains functional but invisible.

Unlocks and enables the help gem feature, making it immediately usable. The help gem provides in-game assistance or hints to the player. This task both unlocks the feature and enables it, setting it to be ready for immediate use.
Enables the help gem feature, allowing the player to use it. This assumes the help gem has already been unlocked. When enabled, the player can access help gem functionality.

Disables the help gem feature, preventing the player from using it. The help gem is also set to be unusable by setting a negative timer value, ensuring it remains disabled until explicitly re-enabled.
Creates a named save file. If the save name already exists, a '+' character is appended until a unique name is found. This allows creating multiple save points without overwriting existing saves.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The name for the save file. If provided and non-empty, creates a named save with this name (adding '+' suffixes if needed to avoid conflicts). If not provided or empty, performs an autosave instead.

uses.description: Performs an autosave without any user-facing notifications or messages. This is a silent save operation that bypasses hardcore mode restrictions, allowing saves even in modes where manual saving is normally disabled.
Performs a full heal on the entire party, restoring all party members' HP and status. This is triggered when no heal amount is specified, providing a complete restoration for the whole party.

Heals a specific actor by a specified amount of HP. The actor is identified by their ID, and the heal amount can be specified (with 0 being treated as a full heal of 9999 HP). If the specified actor doesn't exist in the current zone, this task does nothing.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor to heal. Must be a non-empty actor ID that exists in the current zone.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The amount of HP to restore. If set to 0, automatically becomes 9999 (full heal). Otherwise, restores the specified amount.

uses.description: Heals the task's assigned actor by a specified amount of HP. The heal amount can be specified (with 0 being treated as a full heal of 9999 HP). This form is used when the actor ID string is empty, causing the heal to target the task's own actor.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: Must be an empty string to trigger this use case. A non-empty value would heal that actor instead.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The amount of HP to restore. If set to 0, automatically becomes 9999 (full heal). Otherwise, restores the specified amount.

uses.description: Performs a full heal on the entire party, restoring all party members' HP and status effects. This provides a complete restoration for all party members simultaneously.

Performs a complete restoration of the entire party, healing all HP and removing all negative status effects. This is the most comprehensive party heal, fully restoring the party to perfect condition.

Revives an incapacitated actor, restoring them to life with a specified amount of HP. Optionally, the revived actor can also be cured of all status effects. The heal amount of 0 is treated as a full heal of 9999 HP. If the specified actor doesn't exist, this task does nothing.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor to revive. This actor will be brought back from incapacitation.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The amount of HP to restore when reviving. If set to 0, automatically becomes 9999 (full heal). Otherwise, revives with the specified HP amount.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: When true, also cures all status effects from the revived actor. When false, only revives without removing status effects.

uses.description: Adds a visual effect to the effects queue without specifying a position. The effect will be displayed at a default location. Use this form when only the effect ID is needed.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the visual effect to display.

uses.description: Adds a visual effect at a specific actor's position. The effect will appear centered on the actor, following their location. If the actor doesn't exist, the effect is not displayed.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the visual effect to display.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The ID of the actor at whose position the effect should appear. Must be a valid, non-empty actor ID.

uses.description: Adds a visual effect at the task actor's position. This is triggered when the second string is empty and no tile coordinate is provided. The effect appears at the task's assigned actor's location.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the visual effect to display.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: Must be an empty string to trigger this use case.

uses.description: Adds a visual effect at the camera's position. This is triggered when the second string is empty, no tile coordinate is provided, and there is no task actor. The effect appears at the current camera location.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the visual effect to display.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: Must be an empty string to trigger this use case.

uses.description: Adds a visual effect with a specific color at a tile coordinate. The effect is displayed at the specified tile position with white coloring. This form requires both a tile coordinate and the color flag to be enabled.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the visual effect to display.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: Must be an empty string to allow tile-based positioning.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Must be true to enable the white color effect.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate where the effect should appear.

uses.description: Adds a visual effect at a tile coordinate. The effect is displayed at the specified tile position without color modification. This form requires a tile coordinate but no color flag.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the visual effect to display.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: Must be an empty string to allow tile-based positioning.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Must be false or not provided for standard effect display without color modification.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate where the effect should appear.

uses.description: Plays a sound effect. The sound is played through the sound manager using the specified sound name identifier.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The name of the sound effect to play. Should match a sound defined in the game's sound system. If not provided, no sound is played.

uses.description: Adds a visual effect at the position of the actor the player is currently talking to. The effect appears centered on the talking NPC's location. If there is no current talking actor or the actor doesn't exist, no effect is displayed.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The ID of the visual effect to display at the talker's position. If not provided, no effect is displayed.

uses.description: Adds a visual effect at the position of each party member simultaneously. The same effect appears on all party members, creating a coordinated visual display across the entire party.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The ID of the visual effect to display on each party member. If not provided, no effects are displayed.

uses.description: Displays a floating damage number (or text) above the player's position. The text moves upward and fades out over time. The display duration can be adjusted with a timing modifier.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The text to display as a damage number. Can be actual damage values or any other text.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: A timing modifier added to the base duration of 2 seconds. Positive values make the text display longer, negative values make it shorter.

uses.description: Displays the current in-game world time as a floating damage number above the player's position. The time is formatted as hours:minutes and moves upward while fading out. The display duration can be adjusted with a timing modifier.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: A timing modifier added to the base duration of 2 seconds. Positive values make the time display longer, negative values make it shorter.

uses.description: Triggers an animation on an actor and optionally sets a busy timer. The animation plays on either a specified actor or the task's assigned actor. If a busy duration is provided, the actor is also stunned (preventing actions) for that duration.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the animation to play. Should match an animation defined for the actor's animator.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The busy timer duration in seconds. If greater than 0, the actor is stunned and prevented from acting for this duration. If 0 or negative, no busy timer is set.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The ID of the actor to animate. If provided and non-empty, that actor performs the animation. If empty or not provided, the task's assigned actor performs the animation.

uses.description: Displays an overlay text message on the screen at a specified position. The text can be displayed with a transparency level and positioning control. Additional flags control whether the text can be dismissed or auto-revealed character by character.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: When true, the text cannot be dismissed by the player (inverted internally). When false, the player can dismiss the text.

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: When true, the text does not auto-reveal character by character (inverted internally). When false, the text reveals gradually.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The text message to display. If not provided, displays an empty string.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The transparency/alpha level of the text overlay, cast to a byte value (0-255 range). If not provided, defaults to 0.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The X and Y position for the text overlay. If not provided, both X and Y default to 0.

uses.description: Displays an overlay text message with a tweening animation effect. The text smoothly transitions into view at the specified position with the given transparency level. This creates a more polished visual appearance compared to the standard text overlay.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The text message to display. If not provided, displays an empty string.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The transparency/alpha level of the text overlay, cast to a byte value (0-255 range). If not provided, defaults to 0.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The X and Y position for the text overlay. If not provided, both X and Y default to 0.

uses.description: Displays an overlay text message with dynamic character-by-character reveal animation. The text appears gradually, revealing one character at a time, creating a typewriter effect. Additional flags control dismissibility and auto-reveal behavior.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The text message to display with dynamic reveal.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The transparency/alpha level of the text overlay, cast to a byte value (0-255 range).

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: When true, the text cannot be dismissed by the player (inverted internally). When false, the player can dismiss the text.

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: When true, the text does not auto-reveal character by character (inverted internally). When false, the text reveals gradually.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The X and Y position for the text overlay. If not provided, both X and Y default to 0.

uses.description: Points the camera at a specific tile coordinate with a fixed camera mode. The camera focuses on the specified location, discovers fog of war at that position, and optionally adjusts tracking speed. Flags can lock the camera for the duration of a preventInteraction delay and enable special roof rendering.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: When true, locks the camera for the duration of the current preventInteraction delay timer. When false, the camera can be changed immediately.

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: When true, fixes the camera to render as if under a roof. This affects visual rendering of the scene.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The camera tracking speed. If non-zero, overrides the default tracking speed. If zero or not provided, uses default speed.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate where the camera should point. Must be provided (not (-1, -1)) to use this mode.

uses.description: Points the camera at a specific actor, tracking their movement. The camera follows the actor as they move around the zone. This is triggered when no tile coordinate is provided and an actor ID is specified.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor to track with the camera. The actor must exist in the current zone.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: When true, locks the camera for the duration of the current preventInteraction delay timer. When false, the camera can be changed immediately.

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: When true, fixes the camera to render as if under a roof. This affects visual rendering of the scene.

uses.description: Points the camera at the task's assigned actor or the current actor, tracking their movement. This is triggered when no tile coordinate or actor ID string is provided. The camera follows the actor as they move.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: When true, locks the camera for the duration of the current preventInteraction delay timer. When false, the camera can be changed immediately.

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: When true, fixes the camera to render as if under a roof. This affects visual rendering of the scene.

uses.description: Locks the camera at a specific tile coordinate with a fixed camera mode. The camera is permanently locked at the specified location until explicitly unlocked, discovers fog of war at that position, and optionally adjusts tracking speed. A roof rendering flag can be enabled.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: When true, fixes the camera to render as if under a roof. This affects visual rendering of the scene.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The camera tracking speed. If non-zero, overrides the default tracking speed. If zero or not provided, uses default speed.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate where the camera should be locked. Must be provided (not (-1, -1)) to use this mode.

uses.description: Locks the camera on a specific actor, permanently tracking their movement. The camera is locked to follow the actor until explicitly unlocked. This is triggered when no tile coordinate is provided.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: When true, fixes the camera to render as if under a roof. This affects visual rendering of the scene.

uses.description: Scales (zooms) the camera to a target zoom level. If a tile coordinate is provided, the scaling happens gradually over time at a specified speed. Otherwise, the camera instantly snaps to the target scale.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The target camera scale (zoom level). Values greater than 1.0 zoom in, less than 1.0 zoom out.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: If provided and X > 0, the X coordinate (divided by 10) determines the scaling speed for a gradual zoom. If not provided or X <= 0, the camera snaps instantly to the target scale.

uses.description: Controls whether roofs are always drawn regardless of camera position or other factors. When enabled, roofs render even when they normally wouldn't be visible, which can be useful for specific visual effects or debugging.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: When true, forces roofs to always draw. When false, roofs use normal rendering logic.

uses.description: Cancels task execution if hostile enemies are present within a specified distance from a location. The check can optionally filter for specific enemy types. If the distance is 0, any hostile enemy in the zone cancels the task. The location defaults to the task actor's position or can be specified with a tile coordinate.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The maximum distance in tiles. Enemies closer than this distance will cancel the task. If 0, any hostile enemy in the entire zone cancels the task regardless of distance.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The actor type ID to filter for. If provided, only enemies of this specific type will be checked. If empty or not provided, all hostile enemies are checked.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The center point for the distance check. If not provided (or (-1, -1)) and a task actor exists, uses the task actor's position. Otherwise uses the provided tile coordinate.

uses.description: Cancels task execution if no hostile enemies are present within a specified distance from a location. This is the inverse of cancelIfEnemiesPresent. If the distance is 0, at least one hostile enemy anywhere in the zone is required to continue. The location defaults to the task actor's position or can be specified with a tile coordinate.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The maximum distance in tiles. If no enemies are found closer than this distance, the task is canceled. If 0, at least one hostile enemy must exist in the entire zone to continue.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The center point for the distance check. If not provided (or (-1, -1)) and a task actor exists, uses the task actor's position. Otherwise uses the provided tile coordinate.

uses.description: Cancels task execution if a specific item is present on a tile or within an area. When a tile coordinate is provided, checks that single tile. When no tile coordinate is provided, checks all tiles in the task's area bounds. If the item is found on any checked tile, the task is canceled.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the item to check for. If this item is found on any of the checked tiles, the task is canceled.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The specific tile to check. If not provided (or (-1, -1)), checks all tiles within the task's area bounds instead.

uses.description: Cancels task execution if a specific item is not present on a tile or within an area. When a tile coordinate is provided, that tile must have the item or the task is canceled. When no tile coordinate is provided, at least one tile in the task's area bounds must have the item to continue.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the item to check for. The item must be present for the task to continue.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The specific tile to check. If not provided (or (-1, -1)), checks all tiles within the task's area bounds, requiring at least one to have the item.

uses.description: Cancels task execution based on a formula evaluation. The formula is calculated and if the result is greater than 0 (or greater than or equal to 1 when a boolean flag is set), the task continues. Otherwise, the task is canceled. This provides flexible conditional logic for task execution.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The formula string to evaluate. The formula can reference actor values, global variables, and other game state.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: A parameter passed to the formula calculation that can be used within the formula.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Changes the cancellation condition. When false, cancels if result <= 0. When true, cancels if result < 1 (allowing the task to continue only when result >= 1).

uses.description: Sets the facing rotation of an actor. The actor will face the specified direction (rotation in degrees). This affects which direction the actor appears to be looking or facing, but does not move the actor.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The rotation angle in degrees. Determines which direction the actor faces.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The ID of the actor whose rotation should be set. If provided and non-empty, that actor's rotation is set. If empty or not provided, the task's assigned actor's rotation is set.

uses.description: Sets the facing rotation of all party members simultaneously. All party members will face the same specified direction. This is useful for coordinating party orientation during cutscenes or scripted events.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The rotation angle in degrees. All party members will face this direction.

uses.description: Plays a background music song with customizable volume, pitch, fade-in delay, and override settings. Special keywords 'travelSong'/'travel' and 'combatSong'/'combat' play the zone's configured songs. The song loops continuously until changed or stopped.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The song ID to play. Use 'travelSong'/'travel' for zone's travel song, 'combatSong'/'combat' for zone's combat song, or any valid song ID. If empty or not provided, stops current music.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: X coordinate as volume percentage (0-100), Y coordinate as fade-in delay in seconds. If X is -1, volume defaults to 100%. If Y is -1, delay defaults to 0.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The pitch adjustment for the song. 0 is normal pitch, positive values increase pitch, negative values decrease pitch.

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: When true, this song overrides travel-based song changes, keeping it playing even when traveling between zones.

optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: When true, sets fade-in delay to -99, creating an instant start with no fade-in.

uses.description: Plays the external song associated with the nearest location to the player's current position. This automatically selects music based on proximity to locations, creating dynamic music that reflects the player's geographic context.

Sets the zone's travel and combat songs along with their audio properties. The appropriate song (travel or combat) immediately begins playing based on the current game mode. Song properties include volume, pitch, and combat song delay.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The song ID for travel (non-combat) mode. Can be empty if bools[0] is true.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The song ID for combat mode. Can be empty if bools[1] is true.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The pitch adjustment applied to both travel and combat songs.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: When true, allows setting travel song even if strings[0] is empty, effectively silencing travel music.

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: When true, allows setting combat song even if strings[1] is empty, effectively silencing combat music.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: X coordinate as volume percentage (0-100) for both songs. If X is -1, volume defaults to 100%. Y coordinate is the combat song delay in seconds.

uses.description: Removes items from a tile coordinate or travel point. The item ID can be provided directly or retrieved from a global variable. When a travel point flag is set, interprets the tile coordinate as a travel point identifier instead of a tile position.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the item to remove from the tile or travel point.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The number of items to remove. If 0, automatically becomes 1. Only used in inventory removal mode.

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: When true, interprets tileCoords[0] as travel point coordinates instead of a tile coordinate.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The name of a global variable containing the item ID. If provided and non-empty, retrieves the item ID from this global variable instead of using strings[0].

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate (or travel point coordinates if bools[1] is true) where items should be removed. Must be provided (not (-1, -1)) to use tile/point removal mode.

uses.description: Removes items from the task actor's inventory, falling back to party inventories, stash, and held items if not found. Attempts to remove the specified quantity, searching through available inventories in order until the items are found and removed.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the item to remove from inventories.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The number of items to remove. If 0, automatically becomes 1.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The name of a global variable containing the item ID. If provided and non-empty, retrieves the item ID from this global variable instead of using strings[0].

uses.description: Removes and unequips a specific item from a specific actor's inventory. If the actor has the item equipped, it is first unequipped before removal. If the actor or item doesn't exist, this task does nothing.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor whose inventory should be modified.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The ID of the item to remove from the actor's inventory.

uses.description: Removes items of a specific value or higher from a tile coordinate. This removes items based on their monetary value rather than their ID, useful for removing valuable items regardless of type.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The minimum value threshold. Items with this value or higher will be removed from the tile.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate from which to remove valuable items.

uses.description: Removes all instances of a specific container item from the entire zone if they are empty. This searches every tile in the zone and removes containers of the specified type that have no items inside them, useful for cleaning up empty storage containers.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the container item type to remove when empty. Only containers with this ID that have 0 items inside will be removed.

uses.description: Removes items within a specified radius of the player's current position. The item ID can be provided directly or retrieved from a global variable. This searches all tiles within range and removes matching items from each tile.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the item to remove from tiles near the player.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The maximum distance in tiles from the player. Items on tiles within this radius will be removed.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The name of a global variable containing the item ID. If provided and non-empty, retrieves the item ID from this global variable instead of using strings[0].

uses.description: Removes all items from a specific tile coordinate. All items on that tile are removed at once.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate from which all items should be removed. Must be provided and not (-1, -1).

uses.description: Removes all instances of a specific item from every tile in the entire zone. The item ID can be provided directly or retrieved from a global variable. This performs a zone-wide cleanup of the specified item type.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the item to remove from all tiles in the zone.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The name of a global variable containing the item ID. If provided and non-empty, retrieves the item ID from this global variable instead of using strings[0].

uses.description: Removes all items meeting a minimum value threshold from every tile in the entire zone. This searches the entire zone and removes any items with value greater than or equal to the specified threshold, useful for clearing valuable loot across the map.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The minimum value threshold. Items with this value or higher will be removed from all tiles in the zone.

uses.description: Removes all items from the held items inventory (items currently being carried or transferred). This clears the temporary held items storage, typically used for items being moved or traded.
Adds an item to a specific tile coordinate. The item is placed on the ground at the specified location with an optional force-fit flag.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the item to add. Must be a valid item type defined in the game data.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Force-fit flag. When true, forces the item to be placed even if the tile is full.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The quantity of items to add. If not provided or 0, defaults to 1.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate where the item should be placed. Must be provided (not (-1, -1)).

uses.description: Adds an item to a specific actor's inventory. The actor automatically equips or stores the item. If the actor's inventory is full, the item is dropped at their position.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the item to add. Must be a valid item type defined in the game data.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The ID of the actor who should receive the item. The actor must exist in the current zone.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The quantity of items to add. If not provided or 0, defaults to 1.

uses.description: Adds an item to the task actor's inventory, cargo, or stash depending on item type. Cargo items go to cargo inventory, other items are equipped on the actor if possible. If the actor is controllable, plays a pickup sound. Only adds items the actor doesn't already have.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the item to add. Must be a valid item type defined in the game data.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The quantity of items to add. If not provided or 0, defaults to 1. Actual amount added is reduced by quantity already owned.

uses.description: Adds an item into a container (like a chest or bag) located at a specific tile. Searches for a suitable container on the tile that can fit the item and adds it inside. Can optionally specify which container to target by container ID.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the item to add to the container. Must be a valid item type defined in the game data.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The ID of the specific container item to target. If provided and non-empty, only containers with this ID will be used. If empty or not provided, any suitable container is used.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The quantity of items to add to the container. If not provided or 0, defaults to 1.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate where the container is located. The task searches this tile for suitable containers.

uses.description: Spawns an item at a tile coordinate or travel point. Can optionally spawn a visual effect at the spawn location. The item ID can be provided directly or retrieved from a global variable. Travel point interpretation can be enabled with a flag.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the item to spawn, or the name of a global variable containing the item ID. Must be a valid item type (either directly or after global variable lookup).

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Force-fit flag. When true, forces the item to spawn even if the tile is full.

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: When true, interprets tileCoords[0] as travel point coordinates instead of a tile coordinate.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The quantity of items to spawn. If not provided or 0, defaults to 1.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The ID of a visual effect to play at the spawn location. If provided and non-empty, displays this effect when the item spawns.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate (or travel point coordinates if bools[1] is true) where the item should spawn. Must be provided (not (-1, -1)).

uses.description: Spawns an item at a random location within the task's area bounds. Attempts to find a suitable location where the item can fit, trying up to 50 times before giving up. Can optionally spawn a visual effect at the spawn location.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the item to spawn, or the name of a global variable containing the item ID. Must be a valid item type (either directly or after global variable lookup).

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Force-fit flag. When true, forces the item to spawn even if the chosen tile is full.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The quantity of items to spawn. If not provided or 0, defaults to 1.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The ID of a visual effect to play at the spawn location. If provided and non-empty, displays this effect when the item spawns.

uses.description: Moves all items from the task's top-left area coordinate to a destination tile. All items are removed from the source tile and added to the destination, with force-fit enabled to ensure they are placed even if the destination is full.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The destination tile coordinate where items should be moved to.

uses.description: Moves all items from a tile to a specific actor's inventory. The actor attempts to equip each item, dropping any that don't fit on the ground. After all items are transferred, the source tile is cleared of all items.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor who should receive the items. The actor must exist in the current zone.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate from which items should be taken and moved to the actor.

uses.description: Replaces an equipped item on an actor with a new item. The actor's current item in the specified slot is unequipped and the new item is equipped in that slot. The slot number is automatically adjusted based on item category (armor uses slot 2 if slot 0 is specified, accessories use slot 3 if slot 0 is specified).

required.name: strings[0]
