required.description: The ID of the actor whose equipment should be replaced. The actor must exist in the current zone.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The ID of the new item to equip. Must be a valid item type defined in the game data.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The equipment slot number. For weapons, uses this slot directly. For armor, slot 0 becomes slot 2. For accessories, slot 0 becomes slot 3.

uses.description: Removes an item from an actor's inventory and drops it on the ground at the actor's position. The specified quantity is removed from the actor's inventory and placed on the tile where they are standing.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor who should drop the item. The actor must exist in the current zone.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The ID of the item to drop from the actor's inventory.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The quantity of items to drop. If 0, automatically becomes 1.

uses.description: Buries or unburies all items of a specific type or with a specific special property across the entire zone. Buried items become invisible and non-interactable. This searches every tile in the zone and modifies matching items. Can match by item ID or by special property.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the item type to bury/unbury. All items with this ID will be affected.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: When false, buries the items (makes them invisible). When true, unburies the items (makes them visible).

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The special property name to match. If provided and non-empty, items with this special property will also be buried/unburied, in addition to items matching strings[0].

uses.description: Automatically buries or unburies special items across the zone based on global variable values. Items with the 'setGlobalVarWhenConverted' property are unburied if their corresponding global variable is greater than 0, otherwise they are buried. This creates dynamic item visibility based on game state.

Buries all location marker items for undiscovered locations in the current zone. Location items at and adjacent to undiscovered location coordinates are made invisible, hiding them until the location is discovered. This searches for items with the 'location' special property.

Triggers elemental reactions on pairs of matching items that face each other across the zone. Searches the entire zone for items of a specific type, checks if they face a matching item (or a second specified type) in their facing direction, and triggers 'matched' or 'matchedSelf' reactions on both items when a match is found.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the primary item type to search for. Items of this type will react when they face matching items.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The ID of the secondary item type to match with. If provided and non-empty, primary items react to this type. If empty or not provided, primary items react to other items of the same type (strings[0]).

uses.description: Triggers a special reaction on all party members when they are near key pedestals. Searches the entire zone for 'pedestal_keyhole' items and causes all party members to react with the 'nearKeyPedestal' element, typically used for quest or puzzle state updates.
Removes an actor from the zone by their ID. Optionally plays a visual effect when removing the actor and can transfer the actor's inventory to the player's stash before removal.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor to remove from the zone.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to play a visual effect when removing the actor. When true, plays an FX at the actor's position.

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: Whether to transfer the actor's inventory to the player's stash before removing them. When true, all items the actor is carrying are moved to the stash.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The ID of the visual effect to play when removing the actor. Only used if bools[0] is true. Defaults to 'actor_flee' if not provided.

uses.description: Removes an actor at a specific tile coordinate from the zone. Optionally plays a visual effect when removing the actor and can transfer the actor's inventory to the player's stash before removal.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to play a visual effect when removing the actor. When true, plays an FX at the actor's position.

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: Whether to transfer the actor's inventory to the player's stash before removing them. When true, all items the actor is carrying are moved to the stash.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The ID of the visual effect to play when removing the actor. Only used if bools[0] is true. Defaults to 'actor_flee' if not provided.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate where the actor to remove is located. Must not be (-1, -1).

uses.description: Removes all actors of a specific type from the zone. Iterates through all actors in the current zone and removes those matching the specified actor type ID. Optionally plays a visual effect at each removed actor's position.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The actor type ID to match. All actors with this actorTypeID will be removed from the zone.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to play a visual effect when removing each actor. When true, plays the 'actor_flee' FX at each removed actor's position.

uses.description: Removes despawnable actors from the zone, the special zone if one exists, and clears any held despawnable actor. Despawnable actors are typically temporary or enemy actors that can be cleaned up. When limited to incapacitated actors, this awards XP for defeated hostile enemies that give XP when in combat mode. Also removes despawnable actors from the special zone and clears the held actor if they are despawnable.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to play a visual effect when removing each actor. When true, plays the 'actor_flee' FX at each removed actor's position.

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: When true, only removes incapacitated or drowning despawnable actors. When false, removes all despawnable actors regardless of their state. This affects both the main zone and actor selection for XP awarding.

uses.description: Sets a numeric property on a specific actor to a float value. Uses the DataManager to assign the value by converting it to a string, allowing modification of any numeric actor property that can be set through the data system.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor whose property will be modified.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The name of the property to set on the actor. This should be a valid numeric property name that exists on the actor.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The numeric value to assign to the property.

uses.description: Sets a boolean property on a specific actor. The value is determined by a logical OR of a float and a boolean parameter - the property becomes true if either the float is greater than zero or the boolean is true. This allows flexible boolean assignment from either numeric or boolean inputs.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor whose property will be modified.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The name of the boolean property to set on the actor. This should be a valid boolean property name that exists on the actor.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: A numeric value used in the boolean determination. If greater than zero, the property is set to true.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: A boolean value used in the boolean determination. If true, the property is set to true.

uses.description: Changes an actor's AI script to a new script. The actor's Lua AI system will switch to executing the specified script. Optionally runs the script immediately once after switching to it, which can be useful for initialization or triggering immediate AI behavior changes.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor whose AI script will be changed.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The name of the AI script to switch to. This should be a valid Lua script name that the AI system can execute.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to run the AI script once immediately after switching to it. When true, executes the script specified in strings[0] (note: this appears to use the actor ID, not the script name).

uses.description: Changes the display name of a specific actor. This modifies how the actor appears in dialogs, UI elements, and other places where the actor's name is shown.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor whose name will be changed.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The new name to assign to the actor.

uses.description: Overrides an actor's idle animation with a specific animation. When set, the actor will play the specified animation instead of their default idle animation when not performing other actions.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor whose idle animation will be overridden.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The name of the animation to use as the idle animation override.

uses.description: Changes the dialog node that an actor uses when interacted with. This determines what dialog conversation branch the actor will start when the player talks to them.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor whose dialog node will be changed.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The dialog node ID to assign to the actor. This should be a valid node ID from the game's dialog system.

uses.description: Sets the queued AI actions for a specific actor. This replaces the actor's current AI action queue with a new list of actions, allowing precise control over what the actor will do next. The action list is specified as a string and parsed by the data system.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor whose AI actions will be set.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: A string representation of the queued AI actions list. This should follow the format expected by the DataManager for the queuedAiActions property, including empty entries if needed.

uses.description: Changes all three color palettes of an actor (armor, skin, and cloth) to the same palette simultaneously. This is useful for creating uniform color schemes or visual effects that affect the actor's entire appearance.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor whose palettes will be changed.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The palette name to apply to all three palette types (armorPalette, skinPalette, and clothPalette).

uses.description: Changes the face sprite of the task's assigned actor. Modifies the visual appearance of the actor's face by setting a new sprite for the 'face' body part.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The sprite name to use for the actor's face. This should be a valid face sprite identifier.

uses.description: Sets which body part sprites take priority over the current actor's class defaults. This allows specific visual customizations to override the standard appearance defined by the actor's class. The current actor is the one actively being controlled or selected.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: A string representation of the body part sprites list that should take priority over class defaults. This should follow the format expected by the DataManager for the partSpritesThatTakePriorityOverClass property.

uses.description: Awards base experience points to all actors in the current zone. Each actor receives their standard base XP reward, typically used for rewarding participation in events or encounters.
Moves a specific actor to a tile coordinate and sets their facing rotation. This teleports the actor to the exact position specified rather than pathfinding or walking.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor to move.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The facing rotation to set for the actor after moving them, in degrees.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate to move the actor to.

uses.description: Moves a specific actor to the nearest travel point matching the specified coordinates and sets their facing rotation. This finds a travel point item in the zone and moves the actor to that location.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor to move.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The facing rotation to set for the actor after moving them to the travel point, in degrees.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The coordinates used to identify which travel point to find. The X and Y values are used to construct the travel point identifier.

uses.description: Moves all party members to a specific tile coordinate and points the camera at that location. Optionally sets the facing rotation for all party members. Also adds a brief interaction delay if in travel mode to prevent accidental interactions after teleporting.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The facing rotation to set for all party members after moving them, in degrees. If 0, party members retain their current facing.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The tile coordinate to move the party to. The camera will also target this position.

uses.description: Moves all party members to the nearest travel point matching the specified coordinates. Optionally repositions party members onto specific travel points and spawns player boats in boat zones. This is commonly used for zone transitions and positioning the party at predefined locations.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to put party actors onto travel points after moving. When true, repositions party members onto travel point items matching the Y coordinate from tileCoords[0].

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: Whether to spawn player boats in boat zones. When true and the current zone is a boat zone, adds all boats from the player fleet to the zone and party if they aren't already present.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The coordinates used to identify which travel point to move the party to. The X and Y values are used to construct the travel point identifier.

uses.description: Moves all party members by a relative offset vector and shifts the camera by the same amount. Optionally sets the facing rotation for all party members. The offset is added to each party member's current position, with bounds checking to keep actors within the zone.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The facing rotation to set for all party members after moving them, in degrees. If 0, party members retain their current facing.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The X and Y offset to move each party member by, relative to their current positions.

uses.description: Moves all actors in the zone by a relative offset vector and shifts the camera by the same amount. Optionally sets the facing rotation for all actors. The offset is added to each actor's current position, with bounds checking to keep actors within the zone. This affects all actors, not just party members.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The facing rotation to set for all actors after moving them, in degrees. If 0, actors retain their current facing.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The X and Y offset to move each actor by, relative to their current positions.

uses.description: Adds a specific actor to the player's party. If the actor is not found in the zone, the task fails and returns false, which may affect subsequent task execution.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor to add to the party. The actor must exist in the current zone.

uses.description: Adds the task's assigned actor (typically the actor the player is talking to) to the party as a converted ally and fleet member. If the actor's ID starts with 'hire_', renames them to a unique 'hired_' ID to mark them as hired crew. Slightly reduces crew morale if it's above 70. This is designed for recruiting NPCs during dialogs.

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: Whether to try adding the actor to the landing party (active party members). When true, attempts to add them to the active party rather than just the barracks or fleet.

uses.description: Adds the task's assigned actor to the party as a temporary ally with restricted permissions. The actor cannot have their appearance edited, corpse looted, or be fully controlled. Sets their cloth palette to match the main player. Refreshes their action setup and may add difficulty mode support abilities if applicable. This is designed for temporary companion characters in quests or missions.

Removes a specific actor from the player's party without adding them to the barracks. Optionally also removes them from the fleet. If the actor is not currently in the party, the task fails and returns false, which may affect subsequent task execution.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor to remove from the party. The actor must currently be in the party.

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: Whether to also remove the actor from the fleet. When true, removes them from the fleet in addition to the party.

uses.description: Manages rest and recovery for party members. Active party members are healed without restoring max HP and receive a 'tired' debuff of -2. Barracks crew members are fully healed, with max HP restoration always applied regardless of the 'valueThisRun' global variable check (the condition includes 'or true'). This is typically used at the end of a day or after resting.
Makes all party members invisible for a specified duration. Sets an invisibility timer on each party member, during which they will not be rendered or visible in the game world.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The duration in seconds for which party members will be invisible.

uses.description: Sets a pathfinding route for a specific actor to follow. The actor will either pathfind directly to the destination or follow a waypoint-based route. Optionally modifies the actor's movement speed. The actor's AI target is set to themselves during pathing.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor to path. If the actor is not found in the zone, falls back to the task's assigned actor.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to use waypoint-based pathfinding. When true, finds a path using waypoints and reverses it. When false, uses standard A* pathfinding with the actor's movement area of effect and terrain considerations.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The movement speed to set for the actor during pathing. If greater than 0, overrides the actor's default movement speed. If 0 or less, the actor uses their default speed.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The destination tile coordinate for the actor to path to.

uses.description: Sets pathfinding routes for all party members to the same destination. Each party member pathfinds individually from their current position to the target coordinate using standard A* pathfinding. Party members' AI targets are set to themselves during pathing.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The destination tile coordinate for all party members to path to.

uses.description: Sets a destination for a specific actor without creating a path. The actor's AI will pathfind to this destination on its own. Clears any existing path and AI target. Optionally modifies the actor's movement speed.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor to set a destination for. If the actor is not found in the zone, falls back to the task's assigned actor.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The movement speed to set for the actor. If greater than 0, overrides the actor's default movement speed. If 0 or less, the actor uses their default speed.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The destination tile coordinate for the actor to move toward.

uses.description: Applies direct movement input to an actor, causing them to move in a specific direction. Clears existing paths and movement inputs, makes the actor intangible, and optionally plays a pain animation and modifies movement speed. The movement vector is calculated from the actor's current position to the target coordinate, with -1 values preserving the current axis position.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the actor to apply movement to. If the actor is not found or the string is empty, falls back to the task's assigned actor.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to play a pain animation on the actor during movement. When true, animates the actor with their pain animation at normal speed.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The movement speed to set for the actor. If greater than 0, overrides the actor's default movement speed. If 0 or less, the actor uses their default speed.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The target tile coordinate. For each axis, -1 preserves the actor's current position on that axis; otherwise, the actor moves toward the specified coordinate.

uses.description: Adds a visual effect to the zone at a specific world position. Optionally prevents adding duplicate effects if the same FX already exists in the zone. The effect persists in the zone and can be positioned at specific coordinates.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the visual effect to add to the zone. This should be a valid FX identifier.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to check for duplicates before adding. When true, only adds the effect if it doesn't already exist in the zone. When false, adds the effect regardless of existing instances.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Duration or timing parameter for the zone effect. The exact meaning depends on the effect type.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The world position coordinates (X, Y) where the visual effect should be placed in the zone.

uses.description: Generates and adds tiled special effects covering the entire zone. Creates a grid of 1024x1024 pixel texture tiles, each with generated special FX textures based on the zone terrain. These are typically used for water effects or atmospheric overlays. Can optionally save the generated textures to desktop and supports custom velocity offsets and depth modifications.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The generation mode or parameter for creating the special FX textures. Affects how the textures are generated from the zone terrain.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to create underwater/background effects. When true, effects render behind everything with a large negative depth and use water FX alpha modulation. When false, effects render in front with a large positive depth.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Alpha offset for the effects. When non-zero, sets a custom alpha offset value (as negative integer) for the FX tiles, affecting their transparency.

optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: Whether to save the generated textures to the desktop. When true, saves each generated tile texture as an image file for debugging or inspection.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: Velocity offset for the FX tiles. When not (-1, -1), sets a velocity offset of (X * 0.1, Y * 0.1) for each tile, enables looping around zone edges, and makes effects only draw when roofs are drawn.

uses.description: Removes a visual effect from the zone by its ID. Can remove either the first instance or all instances of the effect.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the visual effect to remove from the zone.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to remove all instances of this effect. When true, removes every instance of this FX ID from the zone. When false, removes only the first instance found.

uses.description: Changes the color palette for zone terrain types. Can target specific terrain palettes (stone, dirt, grass, water, wood, and misc1-8 variations) or set all palettes at once by using an unrecognized palette type name. Accepts various case variations and naming formats for each palette type.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The palette type to modify. Can be: 'stone', 'stoneDark', 'stoneLight', 'dirt', 'dirtDark', 'grass', 'grassDark', 'water', 'misc1' through 'misc8', 'wood', or 'woodDark' (case-insensitive, with or without 'zone' prefix/suffix). Any other value sets all terrain palettes to the same palette.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The palette name to apply to the specified terrain type(s).

uses.description: Toggles the zone's peaceful state, which affects whether combat can occur and actor invincibility. Exits combat mode if currently active. Refreshes peaceful invincibility state on all actors when the peaceful state changes.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to make the zone peaceful. When true, sets the zone to peaceful mode (no combat). When false, allows combat and clears the cantAct restriction.

uses.description: Permanently disables the fog of war for the current zone. Both the zone's fog tracking and the camera's fog rendering are turned off, revealing the entire zone.
Changes the zone's rolling pin rendering style. This affects how the zone is rendered, likely related to scrolling or tiling effects.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: The rolling pin style to apply. True and false likely enable different rendering modes for the zone.

uses.description: Applies a wave effect to the screen darkness shader. Changes the wave sine frequency and triggers the shader timing modulation. Only updates if the new frequency differs from the current value.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The wave sine frequency to apply to the screen dark shader. Affects the visual distortion pattern of the darkness overlay.

uses.description: Enables zone darkness and sets the darkness color. Optionally also applies the darkness color to the camera immediately. This affects the dark overlay color used when the zone is marked as dark.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The color name to use for the zone darkness. Should be a valid color identifier that can be looked up in the game's color data. Alternatively, this can be a color-component value with "R,G,B" or "R,G,B,A" with values specified between 0-255. Note: When specified as a task string, the color components will be split up and probably crash the game. It's possible to set a global variable with setGlobalVarWithCommas and then use @GmyColorVar to correctly insert a color-component value into a task string.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to also apply the darkness color to the camera immediately. When true, skips the gradual transition to the new color.

uses.description: Enables zone darkness and sets the darkness color to match the current outdoor world darkness based on time of day and location. Uses the current location to determine the appropriate darkness color, applying town zone color modulation if the location is a port. Optionally applies the darkness to the camera immediately.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to also apply the darkness color to the camera immediately. When true, sets the camera's darkness color to match the calculated world darkness color.

uses.description: Applies a wave effect to the screen shader. Changes the wave sine frequency and triggers the shader timing modulation. Only updates if the new frequency differs from the current value.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The wave sine frequency to apply to the screen shader. Affects the visual distortion pattern of the wave effect.

uses.description: Changes the zone's background terrain type. This determines what terrain texture is used for the zone background rendering.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The background terrain type ID to use for the zone.

uses.description: Changes the zone's background visual effect. This determines what background FX is rendered behind the zone.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The background FX ID to use for the zone.

uses.description: Initializes or refreshes the waypoint navigation system for the current zone. Forces a complete refresh of waypoint data used for AI pathfinding.
Marks the zone manager as safe. This likely prevents certain dangerous events or encounters from occurring.
Sends a signal to the Lua AI system at the task's assigned actor's position. The signal can carry an integer parameter and is broadcast to AI scripts that listen for it.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The signal name to send to the AI system. AI scripts can listen for and respond to specific signal names.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: An integer parameter to send with the signal. Converted to int, this can carry additional data about the signal.

uses.description: Prevents a trigger from executing by marking it as done in the current zone. Can identify the trigger by either its string ID or numeric ID. Once disabled, the trigger will not execute until re-enabled.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The string ID of the trigger to disable. If non-empty and a matching trigger exists, this ID is used to look up the trigger's numeric ID. If empty, uses floats[0] instead.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The numeric ID of the trigger to disable. Used directly if strings[0] is empty, or overridden by the numeric ID from the string lookup if strings[0] is non-empty and valid.

uses.description: Re-enables a previously disabled trigger, allowing it to execute again. Can identify the trigger by either its string ID or numeric ID. Removes the trigger from the flagged-as-done list for the current zone.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The string ID of the trigger to enable. If non-empty and a matching trigger exists, this ID is used to look up the trigger's numeric ID. If empty, uses floats[0] instead.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The numeric ID of the trigger to enable. Used directly if strings[0] is empty, or overridden by the numeric ID from the string lookup if strings[0] is non-empty and valid.

uses.description: Executes a trigger from the zone or global trigger list. Identifies triggers by string ID. Optionally evaluates a formula condition before executing and can check trigger requirements before execution.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The string ID of the trigger to execute. Searches zone triggers first, then global triggers.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: A formula string to evaluate as a condition. If provided and non-empty, the trigger only executes if the formula evaluates to a value greater than 0.

uses.description: Executes a trigger from the zone. Identifies triggers by numeric ID. Optionally evaluates a formula condition before executing and can check trigger requirements before execution. The trigger is looked up first by string ID from zone or global triggers, then by numeric ID if no string ID is provided.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: When empty, uses floats[0] to look up by numeric ID instead.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The numeric ID of the trigger to execute from the zone's trigger list. Only used if strings[0] is empty.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: A formula string to evaluate as a condition. If provided and non-empty, the trigger only executes if the formula evaluates to a value greater than 0.

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: When true, skips the trigger's requirement checks and executes it unconditionally (except for the optional formula condition in strings[1]). When false or when bools is empty, checks the trigger's normal requirements before executing.

optional.name: bools[1]
optional.description: Parameter passed to the trigger's checkIfCanTrigger method when bools[0] is false. The meaning depends on the trigger implementation. Only used when checking trigger requirements.

uses.description: Adds a global trigger to the current zone if it doesn't already exist in the zone. The trigger is cloned from the global trigger definitions and assigned a new numeric ID.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the global trigger to add to the zone. Must exist in the global trigger definitions.

uses.description: Removes a trigger from the current zone by its string ID. The trigger is permanently removed from the zone's trigger list.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The string ID of the trigger to remove from the zone. Only removes the trigger if this is provided and a matching trigger exists.

uses.description: Applies a special spawn pattern to the zone. Special spawns are predefined spawn configurations that place specific actors or items in designated locations.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the special spawn pattern to apply to the zone.

uses.description: Spawns an actor in the zone from an actor prefabs at the location specified by (X, Y) with optional ID preservation and animation. Actors can be spawned at specific coordinates or within a bounding area.

required.description: Whether to preserve the exact actor ID instead of generating a unique one.

uses.description: Spawns actors in the zone from spawn data. Creates a group of actors at power level relative to the party, with customizable facing, positioning, and visual effects. Actors can be spawned at specific coordinates or within a bounding area.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The spawn data ID. Note: It will first check for an actor prefab with this ID, so make sure the IDs aren't shared.

required.name: bools[0]

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Power level offset added to party power level, enemy spawn modifier, and spawnPowerMod global variable.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: Group ID override for the created actors.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The spawn position or search area. When (-1, -1) or unset, spawns in a random occupiable tile within the task's bounding area. Otherwise, spawns at or near this coordinate, with behavior varying based on spawn type.

uses.description: Spawns an actor in the zone from an actor prefabs at the travel point specified by (X, Y) with optional ID preservation and animation. Actors can be spawned at specific coordinates or within a bounding area.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The actor prefab ID. If this doesn't exist, it will attempt to spawn from spawn data.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to preserve the exact actor ID instead of generating a unique one.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The actor's facing rotation in degrees.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The animation to play on spawn.

Actors can be spawned at specific coordinates or within a bounding area. Travel points are not used. This case is identical to the spawn task.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The spawn data ID. Note: It will first check for an actor prefab with this ID, so make sure the IDs aren't shared.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether spawned actors should look at the center of the spawn area instead of the player.

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: Whether spawned actors should face the player. Only takes effect if bools[0] is false. If this is false, but an X value was specified, actors will also look at the player.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Power level offset added to party power level, enemy spawn modifier, and spawnPowerMod global variable.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: Group ID override for the created actors.

optional.description: The spawn position or search area. When (-1, -1) or unset, spawns in a random occupiable tile within the task's bounding area. Otherwise, spawns at or near this coordinate, with behavior varying based on spawn type.

uses.description: Spawns actors from spawn data whose ID is stored in a global variable. Retrieves the spawn data ID from a global string variable and creates a spawn task with that ID. Useful for dynamically determining which actors to spawn based on game state.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global string variable containing the spawn data ID to use.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: Group ID override for the created actors.

required.name: bools[0]

required.description: When true and coordinates are provided, or when true regardless of coordinates, spawned actors look at the player instead of facing randomly.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Power level offset added to party power level, enemy spawn modifier, and spawnPowerMod global variable.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]

uses.description: Spawns actors from spawn data whose ID is stored in a global variable, positioning them near the player. Retrieves the spawn data ID from a global string variable and creates actors in a small area around the player's position. Optionally spawns behind the player instead of at their position.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The name of the global string variable containing the spawn data ID to use.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: Group ID override for the created actors.

required.description: Whether spawned actors should look at the center of the spawn area instead of the player.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Power level offset added to party power level, enemy spawn modifier, and spawnPowerMod global variable.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: Additional positioning parameters passed to the spawn task.

uses.description: Spawns an actor from a prefab into the special zone at a specific travel point. Creates the actor at a travel point within a set, using coordinates to identify which travel point set and index. The actor is fully healed, has all effects removed, and is added to the special zone rather than the main zone.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The actor prefab ID to spawn. Must be a valid prefab in the actor prefab definitions.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to preserve the exact actor ID instead of generating a unique one.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: Animation to play on the spawned actor.

uses.description: Spawns actors appropriate for the current location based on the location's auto-spawn data. Creates 1-3 spawn groups (more for wealthier locations) from the location's spawn list and positions them on travel points. Also triggers special port spawns if the player owns a home. This is typically used to populate towns and settlements with NPCs.

Spawns actors from spawn data on tiles containing items with a specific special property. Creates actors at power level relative to the party, positions them on matching item tiles, and optionally makes them look at a target position. The actors are marked as giving XP and positioned randomly on matching items.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The spawn data ID to use for creating actors.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: The special property name to search for on items. Actors spawn on tiles containing items with this property.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether to prevent group duplication. When true, does not spawn if a group with this ID already exists.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Power level offset added to party power level, enemy spawn modifier, and spawnPowerMod global variable.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: Optional target position. When not (-1, -1), spawned actors look at this coordinate after spawning.

uses.description: Spawns a sea monster fleet near the task's assigned actor if they are adjacent to deep water. Searches for a monster beacon item to determine which sea monster type to spawn, or uses a default if none found. Creates a hostile sea monster fleet with cargo and positions it in deep water near the actor. Plays a spawn visual effect.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The power level for the sea monster spawn.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The sea monster spawn data ID to use. If empty or not provided, searches for a monster beacon item within 50 tiles to determine the spawn type (sm0-sm9), defaulting to sm0 if no beacon is found.

uses.description: Spawns a complete fleet with ships and crew at a specific position. Creates a fleet using spawn data configurations, with options for merchant status, allied status, and custom faction.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The spawn data ID to use for creating the fleet. Must exist in spawn data definitions.

required.description: The ID of the actor prefab to use as commodore of the fleet.

required.name: bools[0]
required.description: Whether the fleet is a merchant fleet.

required.name: bools[1]
required.description: Whether the fleet is elite.

required.description: Desired power level of the fleet, clamped to the minimum and maximum actors defined in the fleet spawn data.

optional.description: The position where the fleet should spawn.

uses.description: Spawns a random corpse actor from the party's death list into the zone. Selects a corpse that hasn't been spawned yet (tracks up to 2 spawned corpses via global variables). Positions the corpse at the specified coordinate or in the middle of the bounding area if no coordinate is provided.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The position to spawn the corpse. When (-1, -1), spawns in the middle of the task's bounding area.

uses.description: Initiates dialog with a specific actor or displays dialog without an actor. Can optionally position the camera between the player and talker, and can adjust the dialog UI vertical position. If no valid actor ID is provided, displays dialog without pointing the camera.

required.description: The ID of the actor to talk to. If empty or the actor doesn't exist in the zone, displays dialog without an associated actor.

required.description: When false, points the camera between the player and the actor being talked to. When true, skips camera positioning.

optional.description: The Y component is used for the dialog UI vertical position (unless overridden by bools[1]).

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The dialog ID to attempt to start.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: Camera target position during dialog. When not (-1, -1) and dialog successfully starts, fixes the camera at this position.

uses.description: Attempts to start a dialog by its ID, and if successful, points the camera at the enemy fleet's flagship and plays an exclamation visual effect above it. Designed for encounters with enemy fleet commanders.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The dialog ID to attempt to start.

uses.description: Exits dialog mode if currently in a dialog. Changes the game mode from dialog to travel mode.

Attracts the attention of nearby actors to a specific location. Makes hostile actors aware and potentially aggressive. Can operate at the task's assigned actor's position or at a specified coordinate, with customizable radius and actor selection criteria.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The radius distance for the attention effect. Defaults to 12 if not provided or if 0.

uses.description: Attracts the attention of nearby actors to the player's position. Makes hostile actors aware and potentially aggressive toward the player. Uses customizable radius and actor selection criteria.

optional.name: bools[0]
optional.description: Whether to affect actors always, regardless of other conditions. Modifies which actors respond to the attention call.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: The radius distance for the attention effect. Defaults to 12 if not provided or if 0.

uses.description: Executes a special dialog effect by name. Dialog effects are predefined actions that can be triggered from dialog nodes.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: Numeric parameter passed to the dialog effect.

optional.description: Additional string parameter passed to the dialog effect.

required.description: The ID of the special zone to load.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: Depth modification for the special zone rendering. Affects the draw order relative to other elements.

required.description: The target scale factor as a parseable float string. Sets how large the special zone should be scaled to.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The scaling speed. If greater than 0, overrides the default special zone scaling speed.

optional.description: The starting position for the lineup grid. Actors are arranged in rows starting from this coordinate.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The Steam achievement ID to set. This should match a valid achievement identifier in the game's Steam configuration.

Resets the current location's state. This refreshes location data and may respawn NPCs, items, or reset quest states for the current location.

optional.description: The ID of the second combatant actor (typically the flagship of the opposing fleet).

required.description: A formula string to calculate the money amount. If empty, uses floats[0] instead. If non-empty, evaluates the formula to determine the amount.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The money amount to set directly. Only used if strings[0] is empty.

optional.description: The battlefield radius in tiles. Defaults to 18 if not provided or if 0. Determines how large the combat area is.

optional.description: The center position of the combat battlefield. Combat encounters are centered around this coordinate.

uses.description: Initiates combat mode immediately and creates a timed action that executes after a delay. The action timer is added to the zone's action timers and will execute the specified action after the timer expires.

required.description: The action ID to execute when the timer expires.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The delay in seconds before the timed action executes.

optional.name: tileCoords[0]
optional.description: The position for both the combat center and the timed action's target coordinate.

required.description: Whether to treat the combat exit as victorious. When false, exits as victorious. When true, exits as not victorious (inverted logic).

uses.description: Prompts the player with a rest confirmation dialog if in travel mode. Checks if it's safe to rest first and shows an appropriate message. If safe, offers rest; if not safe, warns the player.

This task only works when the player is currently at a location.

Opens buy mode for purchasing goods from an NPC fleet's cargo. The cargo of the fleet associated with the task's assigned actor is displayed as the buying source, and the player's fleet cargo is opened for receiving the purchased goods.

required.description: The price multiplier to apply to buy transactions. Standard pricing is 1.0.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the item type to purchase.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The initial quantity to display in the slider. If set to 0, it will default to 1.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The initial quantity to display in the slider. If set to 0, it will default to 1.

uses.description: Automatically purchases as much food as possible to fill the player's cargo hold. Calculates the remaining cargo capacity and buys food to fill it, limited by the player's available money. The food is added to the fleet's cargo inventory and the cost is deducted from the player's money.

Purchases a specified quantity of food. Calculates the cost based on the food's value and the requested quantity. If the player has enough money, the cost is deducted and the food is added to the fleet's cargo inventory.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The quantity of food to purchase.

uses.description: Purchases a specified quantity of the current location's trade good. The trade good type is automatically determined from the location associated with the current zone. required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The quantity of trade goods to purchase.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The quantity of food to give to the player.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The quantity of the item to remove.

required.name: floats[0]

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The quantity of the item to remove.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The ID of the item type to remove from the party.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The quantity of the item to remove.

uses.description: Refreshes stat modifiers for all actors in the current zone and all party members (both active party and barracks). This recalculates any temporary or equipment-based stat bonuses and penalties, ensuring all character statistics are up to date.

Grants shared experience points to all party members (both active party and barracks) if the XPShare global variable is set. Awards 5% of the accumulated experience in each class's global XP pool to each party member. This only applies to classes that have accumulated more than 100 XP in their pool. The awarded XP is not affected by party size and ignores tired states.
Marks the task's assigned actor as hostile, making them aggressive towards the player.

Makes the player's actor initiate combat with the task's assigned actor. Both actors are animated to idle first, then the player attacks the target actor. This represents the player starting the fight.
Makes the task's assigned actor initiate combat with the player. Both actors are animated to idle first, then the target actor attacks the player. This represents the enemy starting the fight.

Rewards the player with money based on the value of a quest item. The quest item ID is retrieved from the 'tavern_questItem' global variable, and the player receives money equal to that item's value. The money amount is also added to the 'earnedCashTotal' global variable for tracking.

Generates a new random quest item. Creates a 'loot_quest' item and generates its actual contents, then stores the resulting item ID in the 'tavern_questItem' global variable. This is used to assign new quest objectives.

Conditionally jumps to a different dialog node if a formula evaluates to true (value >= 1). The formula is evaluated in the context of the task's assigned actor. If the condition is met, the dialog immediately switches to the specified node.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: A formula expression that determines whether to jump. If it evaluates to 1 or greater, the jump occurs.

required.description: The delay duration in seconds before jumping to the new node.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The delay duration in seconds.

optional.name: floats[0]
optional.description: An optional delay parameter passed to the dialog node change function. Purpose unclear from the code.

uses.description: Increments the task's assigned actor's default dialog node ID. If the actor has a dialog node set, it's incremented to the next sequential ID (e.g., 'node1' becomes 'node2'). If the node is empty, no action is taken.
Sets the task's assigned actor's default dialog node ID. If a node ID is provided as input, it uses that value; otherwise, it uses the current dialog node ID being executed.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The dialog node ID to set. If not provided, uses the current dialog node ID.

uses.description: Conditionally sets the task's assigned actor's default dialog node ID if a formula evaluates to true (value >= 1). The formula is evaluated in the context of the task's assigned actor. If the condition is met, the actor's dialog node is set to the specified ID.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The dialog node ID to set if the condition is met.

required.name: strings[1]
required.description: A formula expression that determines whether to set the node. If it evaluates to 1 or greater, the node is set.

uses.description: Clears the task's assigned actor's default dialog node ID, setting it to an empty string. This removes any assigned dialog behavior from the actor.

Makes the task's assigned actor flee from combat, removing them from the zone. The player is awarded 90% of the actor's XP value. A visual effect plays at the actor's position (defaults to 'actor_flee' but can be customized). Combat is delayed until the player acknowledges the flee notification. The XP is added to either the boat or standard XP pool depending on whether the fleeing actor is a boat.

optional.name: strings[1]
optional.description: The visual effect ID to play when the actor flees. If not provided, defaults to 'actor_flee'.

uses.description: Makes the entire enemy combat group flee from battle. All actors in the same faction within range of the task's assigned actor are removed from the zone with a flee visual effect. All party members are awarded XP based on the total power level of the fleeing group (90% of 105% of the power level).

Makes the player's party flee from combat. All party members become invisible for a duration (starting at 12 seconds, with 3 additional seconds per party member). All actors in the same faction as the task's assigned actor within range are reset: they stop targeting, look at the player, and have their 'auto' dialog node cleared.
Increases morale for all actors in the enemy combat group. All actors in the same faction within range of the task's assigned actor receive a morale bonus of +1 for 65 seconds.
Decreases morale for all actors in the enemy combat group. All actors in the same faction within range of the task's assigned actor receive a morale penalty of -1 for 65 seconds.
Increases morale for all party members. Each party member receives a morale bonus of +1 for 65 seconds.
Modifies the player's crew morale by a specified amount. Positive values increase morale, negative values decrease it.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The amount to modify crew morale by. Can be positive or negative.

uses.description: Makes peace with the enemy combat group and awards XP to the party. All actors in the same faction within range of the task's assigned actor become non-hostile, stop giving XP when killed, and have their 'auto' dialog node changed to 'auto_peaceful'. All party members are awarded XP based on the total power level of the group (90% of 105% of the power level).

Awards peace XP to the party without changing enemy behavior. All party members receive XP based on the total power level of the task's assigned actor's combat group (90% of 105% of the power level). Unlike the 'peace' task, this does not make enemies non-hostile or modify their dialog.
Moves the camera's target position by specified X and Y offsets. The camera smoothly moves to the new position.

Makes the task's assigned actor move in the negative Y direction (up) with a movement vector of (0, -1).
Sets the player actor's facing rotation to a specified angle. The rotation change triggers a facing rotation effect after a minimal delay.

Sets the task's assigned actor's facing rotation to 180 degrees (facing left). The rotation change triggers a facing rotation effect after a minimal delay.
Sets the task's assigned actor's facing rotation to 0 degrees (facing right). The rotation change triggers a facing rotation effect after a minimal delay.
Sets the task's assigned actor's facing rotation to 270 degrees (facing up). The rotation change triggers a facing rotation effect after a minimal delay.

Sets the task's assigned actor's facing rotation to the previously stored rotation value. This uses the rotation value saved by the setPrevFacingRot task. The rotation change triggers a facing rotation effect after a minimal delay.
Stores the task's assigned actor's current facing rotation for later use with facingRotPrev. If a rotation value is provided as input, that value is stored instead of the actor's current rotation.

optional.description: A rotation angle to store. If not provided, stores the actor's current facing rotation.

uses.description: Makes the player actor turn to face the task's assigned actor (the talker). Makes the task's assigned actor turn to face the player. Calculates the direction from the actor to the player and sets the actor's facing rotation accordingly, snapped to the nearest 90-degree angle. If the actor is moving, the rotation is reapplied with delays to ensure it sticks.
Sets the task's assigned actor's AI script to 'idle'. This changes the actor's behavior to idle AI patterns.
Sets the task's assigned actor's AI script to 'idle_flag'. This changes the actor's behavior to idle flag AI patterns.
Kills the task's assigned actor by removing their unkillable status and dealing 99999 damage to their HP. This guarantees the actor's death.

Removes the task's assigned actor from the zone, deleting them from the game.

Shows the character stats UI panel. This forces the character statistics display to be visible on screen.
Shows the quickslots UI panel. This forces the quickslot action bar to be visible on screen and un-hides the UI.
Hides the quickslots UI panel by setting the hideQuickslots flag to false. Note: The implementation appears to have inverse logic and may actually show quickslots.
Sets the visibility of the combat UI. This can show or hide combat-related interface elements.

required.description: Whether to show (true) or hide (false) the combat UI.

uses.description: Opens the escape menu showing only the faction information panel (right side). The main escape menu and left info panel are hidden. Sets the dialog to hide when moving to the next node.
Hides all escape menu windows, including the main menu, left info panel, and right info panel (faction window).
Unlocks and enables the help gem feature for the player. If the gem wasn't previously unlocked, plays visual and sound effects at the player's position. The gem becomes immediately usable.

Uses the 'valueThisRun' and 'deathsThisRun' global variables to categorize the run (profit level and deaths), finds matching dialog nodes, and selects the least-used one to provide variety. Increments the usage counter for the selected node. Falls back to 'goToTown' if no matching nodes exist.

Categorizes unsold journal entries by rarity, calculates money and fame rewards for each, and dynamically creates dialog statements describing the findings and rewards. Marks all processed entries as sold to prevent duplicate rewards. Clears and rebuilds the specified dialog node with the generated report.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The dialog node ID where the research report will be generated.

uses.description: Generates a cartographer's report on world exploration progress. Provides bonus rewards if the map is completely revealed (100%). Dynamically generates dialog statements describing progress and rewards.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The dialog node ID where the cartographer report will be generated.

If the location has no faction, it increases trade fame and decreases piracy fame more significantly. Favor increases are based on 0.1% of the donation amount.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The amount of money to donate.

Clears existing options and rebuilds the dialog structure based on the location's available quests.

required.name: strings[0]
required.description: The dialog node ID where job options will be generated.

uses.description: Debug command that displays the total XP cost for all abilities in each selectable class. This command calculates and shows on screen the sum of all XP costs for every action/ability within each class that can be selected by players. This is useful for balancing and debugging class progression costs. This command does not modify any game state, only displays information.

Debug command that calculates and displays XP costs for skill progression using a custom formula. This command computes costs for 12 progression levels using the formula: ((base + level * increment) * multiplier^level). The results are displayed as a comma-separated list on screen. This is useful for testing and balancing XP progression curves for skills and abilities. If fewer than 3 float values are provided, an error message is displayed instead.

required.name: floats[0]
required.description: The base cost value. This is the starting point for the cost calculation, applied at level 0. The value is cast to an integer before being used in the formula.

required.name: floats[1]
required.description: The linear increment per level. This value is added for each level and determines how much the base cost grows linearly with each progression level.

required.name: floats[2]
required.description: The exponential multiplier. This value is raised to the power of the current level, creating exponential growth in the cost curve. Values greater than 1 create increasing costs, while values less than 1 create decreasing costs.

uses.description: Debug command that unlocks all selectable classes in the game for the player. This command iterates through every class that can be selected by players and unlocks them by setting the appropriate global variables and adding them to the player's known classes list. For classes with formula requirements that reference global variables (starting with 'g:'), it sets those specific global variables. For other classes, it sets a 'class_' prefixed global variable. This allows immediate access to all classes without meeting normal unlock requirements.
Debug command that adds money to the player's current funds. By default, this adds 500 gold pieces to the player's total money. The amount can be customized by providing a float value.

optional.name: floats[0]

Debug command that toggles the visibility of menus on or off. This hides or shows all menu UI elements in the game.
Debug command that toggles whether tooltips are drawn on screen. This can be used to hide or show all tooltip UI elements.
Debug command that toggles the display of damage numbers. When enabled, damage numbers appear over characters when they take or deal damage. When disabled, these numbers are hidden.
Debug command that toggles the visibility of quickslots and character stats UI elements. This hides or shows these interface components completely.
Debug command that toggles combat mode on or off. This enables or disables the combat system entirely. The current state of combat mode is displayed on screen when toggled.
Debug command that toggles the visibility of the combat UI. When enabled, combat UI elements are hidden all the time. When disabled, they display normally.
Debug command that toggles the drawing of wires (debug visualization lines). This visual debugging aid helps visualize connections and paths in the game.
Debug command that toggles realtime mode on or off. This switches between turn-based and realtime gameplay modes.

Debug command that makes all party members invisible. This sets each party actor's invisibility timer to a very high value (99999 seconds) and marks them as not visible. This is useful for testing scenarios without the party being visible on screen.
Debug command that toggles the display of mouse position coordinates on screen. This shows or hides the current mouse cursor position, useful for debugging UI and positioning.
Debug command that toggles the visual style used to display ability ranks. This switches between using notches (visual marks) or another display method for showing skill ranks.

Debug command that clears all journal entries and resets them to the default starting entries. This removes all learned journal entries from the player's knowledge and then re-adds only the default known journal entries that players start with. Alerts for new entries are suppressed during this reset.

Debug command that unlocks all journal entries in the game. This adds every journal entry that exists in the game data to the player's known journal entries list, giving immediate access to all lore and information. After adding all entries, the journal is sorted by category for organization.
Debug command that toggles debug mode on or off. Debug mode enables various debugging features and information displays. The current state of debug mode is displayed on screen when toggled.

Debug command that counts and displays the total number of items or actors in the current zone. When given an item or actor ID, it counts instances of that specific type. When no ID is provided, it counts all items on all tiles. The result is displayed on screen.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The ID of the item or actor type to count. If provided, only instances of this specific item or actor type are counted. For items, it counts across all tiles. For actors, it counts matching actors in the zone. If not provided, all items in the zone are counted.

uses.description: Debug command that searches all zone data files across the entire game world and counts occurrences of a specific string pattern. This is useful for finding how many times an item, actor, or other game element appears across all zones. The command displays both per-zone counts (for zones where the pattern appears) and a total count. If no search string is provided, it automatically detects what the mouse is hovering over (either an actor or item) and searches for that.

optional.name: strings[0]
optional.description: The search pattern to count across all zone data files. This is typically formatted as part of a data definition (e.g., 'Item] ID=torch' or 'actorTypeID=merchant'). If not provided, the command examines the tile under the mouse cursor and automatically determines the search pattern from whatever actor or item is at that location.

required.description: Whether to enable the main menu background and UI manager drawing. When true, both the main menu background and the UI manager are set to draw. When false, these remain in their current state.
